title: Isn't there any support about encryption of local database?
body:
Hi,
I'm developing a Windows Universal App, and I'm sicked and tired of finding a way to implement encrypted local DB support.
(I already have a database file encrypted by SQL Cipher and I just have to read the records)
I know SQLite support Universal App Development through Nuget in VS2015
But SQLCipher is not - it supports only commercial edition ($899) and I can't afford the expense.
So I tried to find other ways such as Excel, Access, or SQL Server Compact Edition.

comments.body: @Luciano with UWP you can use EF7 core which internally uses SQLite or you can use SQLite directly. UWP now supports System.Data.Sqlite explicitly by means of Command etc. Excel and Access have seen better days though you are SQLite is a new mobile standard now.
If you know the password, any desktop tool that support SQL Server Compact can open the database file
the encrypted dabase file generated by WPDT can't be open with VS2010 or SQL server 2008.Hope you can fix this
